H0.text: Iron is the material attracted to a magnet.

H1.text: Wood is not attracted to a magnet.

H2.text: Plastic is the material attracted to a magnet.

H3.text: Ice is a material that is attracted to a magnet.

A4.text: Below its Curie point of 770 °C (1,420 °F; 1,040 K), α-iron changes from paramagnetic to ferromagnetic: the spins of the two unpaired electrons in each atom generally align with the spins of its neighbors, creating an overall magnetic field.

A5.text: Iron, cobalt, and nickel are ferromagnetic at room temperature and share similar chemistry.
